concept:name: SubmitCommit
message:
Limit usage of ES template parameter "include_type_name".

Using parameter "include_type_name" with versions of ES that didn't yet support the parameter failes with `unrecognized parameter: [include_type_name]`

This change addresses that by limiting the usage to ES >= 6.7 < 7.0

concept:name: ReviewApproved
message: there's probably a test in ElasticsearchStorageTest that conditionally adds this based on a version, and there could be a new test to prove it doesn't for 6.6.6 the devil's ES

concept:name: Revise
message: Adds some tests for includes_type_name param

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
Test is failing because of lack of license in YAML files. Not sure this is truly needed:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3075074/134905710-305657dd-69b2-4c8e-b5f9-b8ffd0a09e66.png)

Shall we @basvanbeek @abesto?

concept:name: IssueComment
message: yes we should have the license headers in.

concept:name: IssueComment
message: No problem, I've added them. Can someone trigger a re-test?

concept:name: IssueComment
message: Hm, the headers are there, albeit probabky in a different format your test expects. I've used Helm block comments (`{{- /* ... */ }}`) where possible, as the license applies to the templates and not to the generated manifests. I suspect the test does not like that. Although `Chart.yaml` and `values.yaml` contain simple YAML-comments (as they are not templated) and also make the test angry. Does the test work at all for YAML? Anything I can do about this?

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
Did some digging in [license-maven-plugin](https://github.com/mojohaus/license-maven-plugin), and [it seems to me](https://github.com/mojohaus/license-maven-plugin/tree/master/src/main/java/org/codehaus/mojo/license/header/transformer) that it is limited in types of files / comment styles supported. I cannot seem to find YAML or Helm-style comments in there. 

One could (in theory) submit YAML/Helm support into that plugin, and bump the license-mavin-plugin version in this repo afterwards, but I am not eager to jump on that boat.

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
I am inclined to say we should ignore that folder for now but I'd like to
hear from @basvanbeek and @llinder. Also would be cool to see @abesto
around here.

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
Who me? Hi! :D
TBH I don't think I should have a word on setting the requirements for this - that is, whether it's OK to not have license headers in these files. I know this was extremely important under ASF, I'm not sure how much we care about it now. Personally I wouldn't worry about ignoring all YAML files.

On the technical front, AFAICT YAML supports line comments starting with `#`, which the Maven plugin also supports with the `properties` comment style. So possibly it's a matter of submitting a PR to the plugin that adds `.yaml` to the default extension list? Though note, that transformer also understands hashbangs, which are invalid in YAML, but whatever. Better yet, https://www.mojohaus.org/license-maven-plugin/check-file-header-mojo.html#extraExtensions looks like it's possible to add an extra extension in configuration. So maybe that'd fly?

concept:name: IssueComment
message: @jonkerj could we avoid that folder to move on? cc @basvanbeek

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
> @jonkerj could we avoid that folder to move on? cc @basvanbeek

Sure, but I wouldn't know how. I am not familiar with the build system (it's maven, right?) and got lost trying to find this out. If someone can point me to other stuff getting ignored by this check, I'll see that I replicate that to my folder.

concept:name: IssueComment
message: Bump

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
@jonkerj
ingress.yaml:
`{{- $svcPort := .Values.service.port -}}`   should be `{{- $svcPort := .Values.service.zipkin.port -}}`
values.yaml:
`service:
  tracing:
    type: ClusterIP
    port: 80
  zipkin:
    type: ClusterIP
    port: 9411
`
Anyway... good work.. Thank you!

concept:name: Revise
message:
feature: add Helm chart for zipkin-server

Signed-off-by: Lukas van Schagen <lukas.vanschagen@eu.equinix.com>

concept:name: Revise
message:
fix: disable automounting of service account token

Signed-off-by: Jorik Jonker <jorik.jonker@eu.equinix.com>

concept:name: Revise
message:
fix: support three types of ingress

Chart lacked logic to support ingress v1, so it supports all three now:
- legacy extensions/v1beta1 (.. 1.21)
- networking.k8s.io/v1beta1 (1.14 .. 1.21)
- networking.k8s.io/v1 (1.19 .. )

Signed-off-by: Jorik Jonker <jorik.jonker@eu.equinix.com>

concept:name: Revise
message: fix: reference correct port variable

concept:name: Revise
message:
fix: add license to helm chart files

Signed-off-by: Jorik Jonker <jorik.jonker@eu.equinix.com>

concept:name: Revise
message:
fix: make ingress templating/values easier

Previous templating contained confusing options for multiple
hosts/paths, while this is propbably never used.

Signed-off-by: Jorik Jonker <jorik.jonker@eu.equinix.com>

concept:name: IssueComment
message: @mrfelek : thanks for the sharp eye, don't know how we could have missed that. Still looking for hints on how to exclude the chart subdir from the license header check. Can anyone point me towards the right direction?

concept:name: IssueComment
message: @jonkerj are you on twitter? I'd like to have a word with you.

concept:name: IssueComment
message: I'm sorry, I'm not on Twitter. I'm on several slacks (Talos, CNCF, Cilium, Kubernetes), though

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
Don't want to sound impatient, but I've got the feeling this PR and the conversation around it is stalling a bit. Don't get me wrong: we really love to help in getting this chart included, and believe it would boost the adaption of Zipkin in a Kubernetes environment. 

If this has no priority from the main devs: totally fine and we'd respect that, and we will find a different approach, but please be clear about this.

concept:name: IssueCommentSupplement
message: Let's merge this I will address the headers in a next PR.

```
$ ./mvnw -T1C -q --batch-mode -DskipTests --also-make -pl zipkin-server clean package
```

concept:name: Revise
message:
chore: exclude chart folder from license check.

We chose to skip the check in chart repository because although it is a yaml file, the comment structure for the helm templates requires a different format than yaml (see https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/3378\#issuecomment-933235104) and even with custom header type we can't match both.

concept:name: SubmitCommit
message:
fix: add Helm chart CD to GH pages

helm/chart-releaser-action maintains a file `index.yaml` in branch
`gh-pages`, which refers to the chart tgz release files.

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
OK, it was kind of tricky to test, because:
- The CD workflow needs to be in the default branch (ie, `master`)
- The workflow is only triggered by changes in `chart/**`

So, what I did:
1. I forked the repo (actually, already had a fork to create this PR)
2. merged the branch into `master` (so the CD action was in place)
3. changed something bogus under `chart/`, committing it into `master`
4. Observed a helm-release was cut out
5. Branched master, changed something bogus again, create a PR
6. Observed that the chart was getting linted

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/951654/144613576-2761ae9f-4700-4a25-a649-445ea83882a2.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/951654/144613638-48e29c83-6bd7-4b87-9877-8144bec75197.png)

concept:name: SubmitCommit
message:
log4j 2 fix for CVE-2021-44228

This diff overrides the log4j 2 version from transitive dependency in spring boot.
See https://spring.io/blog/2021/12/10/log4j2-vulnerability-and-spring-boot for details.

Test Plan:
> ./mvnw dependency:tree | grep log4j
[INFO] +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-api:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-core:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-slf4j-impl:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-jul:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] +- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-log4j2:jar:2.4.1:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-api:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-core:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-slf4j-impl:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.apache.logging.log4j:log4j-jul:jar:2.15.0:compile
[INFO] |  +- org.springframework.boot:spring-boot-starter-log4j2:jar:2.4.1:compile

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
I know zipkin is probably not vulnerable to 22965, the problem is this note at the end of the advisory:
"However, the nature of the vulnerability is more general, and there may be other ways to exploit it."
So my organization is mandating we update the version to remediate this.
All tests are passing in my local

concept:name: IssueComment
message:
Since i updated the mysql version last week and resubmitted the version went up again from 10.6.7 to 10.6.8, it's kind of annoying the hard coded version in the dockerfile has to match the latest one it finds at https://pkgs.alpinelinux.org/packages?name=mysql

I also updated to spring boot 2.5.14 since they also released that.
I don't have docker installed locally so can't run all the tests, but all tests i'm able to run are passing.
May have to work with another developer if any other tests are failing, or find some way to get docker installed.
Unfortunately my organization blocks github so i'm doing this on a personal iMac i don't normally do development with.
